member.name: M:Sudoku.UI.Interoperability.AppWindowMarshal.GetDpiForMonitor(System.IntPtr,Sudoku.UI.Interoperability.Monitor_DPI_Type,System.UInt32@,System.UInt32@)
member.summary: Queries the dots per inch (dpi) of a display.
member.param: Handle of the monitor being queried.

param.name: dpiType
param.para: The type of DPI being queried. Possible values are from the enumeration.

member.param: The value of the DPI along the X axis. This value always refers to the horizontal edge, even when the screen is rotated.
The value of the DPI along the Y axis. This value always refers to the vertical edge, even when the screen is rotated.
member.returns:
This function returns one of the following values.
Return code Description
S_OK The function successfully returns the X and Y DPI values for the specified monitor.
E_INVALIDARG The handle, DPI type, or pointers passed in are not valid.

remarks.para:
This API is not DPI aware and should not be used if the calling thread is per-monitor DPI aware. For the DPI-aware version of this API, see
GetDpiForWindow .

When you call GetDpiForMonitor, you will receive different DPI values depending on the DPI awareness of the calling application. DPI awareness is an application-level property usually defined in the application manifest. For more information about DPI awareness values, see
PROCESS_DPI_AWARENESS . The following table indicates how the results will differ based on the PROCESS_DPI_AWARENESS value of your application.
PROCESS_DPI_UNAWARE 96 because the app is unaware of any other scale factors.
PROCESS_SYSTEM_DPI_AWARE
A value set to the system DPI because the app assumes all applications use the system DPI.
PROCESS_PER_MONITOR_DPI_AWARE The actual DPI value set by the user for that display.
The values of * and * are identical. You only need to record one of the values to determine the DPI and respond appropriately.
When MONITOR_DPI_TYPE is or , the returned DPI value does not include any changes that the user made to the DPI by using the desktop scaling override slider control in Control Panel.

For more information about DPI settings in Control Panel, see
the Writing DPI-Aware Desktop Applications in Windows 8.1 Preview white paper .

member.name: T:Sudoku.UI.Interoperability.IInitializeWithWindow
member.summary: Exposes a method through which a client can provide an owner window to a Windows Runtime (WinRT) object used in a desktop application.

remarks.para:
When to initialize:
Implement this interface if your object needs to be provided with an owner window, generally to display UI. Most third-party applications will not need to implement this interface.

When to use:
Use this interface if you will provide an owner window to a WinRT object in a desktop application. For more information about this scenario, see
Classes that use IInitializeWithWindow .

This interface is implemented by the following objects. Note that this is necessarily an incomplete list; refer to an individual object's documentation to determine whether that object implements this interface.

member.name: M:Sudoku.UI.Interoperability.IInitializeWithWindow.Initialize(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Specifies an owner window to be used by a Windows Runtime (WinRT) object that is used in a desktop app.
member.param: The handle of the window to be used as the owner window.
member.remarks:
The method doesn't return anything, but the method returns an HResult value in the Win32 API. For more information, please visit
this link .

member.name: T:Sudoku.UI.Interoperability.Monitor_DPI_Type
member.summary: Identifies the dots per inch (dpi) setting for a monitor.
member.remarks:
All of these settings are affected by the
PROCESS_DPI_AWARENESS of your application.

member.name: F:Sudoku.UI.Interoperability.Monitor_DPI_Type.MDT_Effective_DPI
member.summary: The effective DPI. This value should be used when determining the correct scale factor for scaling UI elements. This incorporates the scale factor set by the user for this specific display.

member.name: F:Sudoku.UI.Interoperability.Monitor_DPI_Type.MDT_Angular_DPI
member.summary: The angular DPI. This DPI ensures rendering at a compliant angular resolution on the screen. This does not include the scale factor set by the user for this specific display.

member.name: F:Sudoku.UI.Interoperability.Monitor_DPI_Type.MDT_Raw_DPI
member.summary: The raw DPI. This value is the linear DPI of the screen as measured on the screen itself. Use this value when you want to read the pixel density and not the recommended scaling setting. This does not include the scale factor set by the user for this specific display and is not guaranteed to be a supported DPI value.

member.name: F:Sudoku.UI.Interoperability.Monitor_DPI_Type.MDT_Default
member.summary: The default DPI setting for a monitor is .
